source.name: Interoperability Use Case Identification
source.instructions: Which of the following scenarios best represents a use case for blockchain interoperability?

answers.answer: Transferring Bitcoin to the Ethereum network for use in DeFi applications
Mining new cryptocurrency tokens on a single blockchain
Storing personal data on a private blockchain
Creating a new smart contract on the Ethereum network
Verifying transactions within a single blockchain network

source.guidance: The correct answer is "Transferring Bitcoin to the Ethereum network for use in DeFi applications." This scenario exemplifies blockchain interoperability as it involves moving assets (Bitcoin) from one blockchain to another (Ethereum) for cross-chain utility. The other options do not involve interaction between different blockchain networks: mining tokens, storing data, creating smart contracts, and verifying transactions can all occur within a single blockchain ecosystem. This question tests the student's ability to recognize practical applications of blockchain interoperability in the context of cross-chain asset transfers and DeFi use cases.
source.learningObjectives: SWBAT identify real-world use cases of blockchain interoperability
